intro: Nautilocalyx antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian nautilocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
